intro_profile.name: Audrey Horne
intro_profile.overview: You are Audrey Horne, daughter of Twin Peaks' wealthiest family. You move through high society with grace and mystery, always knowing more than you let on. You're here to celebrate Marlena, but you've been hearing whispers about stolen recipes and false heritage claims.
intro_profile.personality_notes: Confident, mysterious, observant. You notice things others miss and aren't afraid to ask pointed questions.
intro_profile.secret_preview: You know about Morgan's investor pitch and suspect something isn't quite right...

envelopes.title: Envelope 1: Suspicious Investments
envelopes.contents: You attended Morgan's investor pitch last week. She promised 'authentic heritage recipes' would make everyone rich. But you know Morgan's family isn't originally from Twin Peaks. Something doesn't add up.
envelopes.instructions: Share your clue about Morgan's false heritage claims. Ask others about recipe origins and Cassandra's investigation.

envelopes.title: Envelope 2: Following the Money
envelopes.contents: You've always followed the money in this town. When you do, the trail leads straight to Morgan's new pie business. The investors are already here, expecting authenticity. What happens when they learn the truth?
envelopes.instructions: Investigate Morgan's business dealings. Connect financial motive to the recipe theft.

envelopes.title: Envelope 3: The Investment Contracts
envelopes.contents: You found copies of the investor contracts—$50K promised to Morgan for her 'authentic heritage pie business.' Everything depends on that stolen recipe being believable. Cassandra's exposure would destroy it all.
envelopes.instructions: Share the contract evidence. This is the motive Morgan had for silencing Cassandra.

envelopes.title: Envelope 4: The Complete Picture
envelopes.contents: Cassandra's draft article 'The Great Recipe Heist' names Morgan directly with photo proof. Morgan had everything to lose—money, reputation, her business dreams. The cupcake reveal will expose the truth.
envelopes.instructions: Present your evidence. Prepare for the cupcake reveal ceremony that will spell out Morgan's guilt.

intro_profile.name: Special Agent Dale Cooper
intro_profile.tagline: Trust your intuition and follow the evidence
intro_profile.overview: You are Special Agent Dale Cooper, an FBI agent with unconventional methods. You believe in following evidence and reading the signs. While you're here to celebrate, your investigative instincts never rest. Something about this food blogger's death doesn't sit right.
intro_profile.personality_notes: Earnest, methodical, highly observant. You document everything and find meaning in small details.
intro_profile.secret_preview: You're analyzing evidence that points to recipe theft and murder...

envelopes.title: Envelope 1: Initial Investigation
envelopes.contents: You've confirmed the deputy's alibi—he's clear. Now you turn your attention to others. The blogger Cassandra was investigating local recipes. Her notes mention interviewing Norma about cherry pie. Why would that be dangerous?
envelopes.instructions: Share the deputy's elimination. Document suspicious behaviors. Begin connecting recipe investigation to motive.

envelopes.title: Envelope 2: Building the Case
envelopes.contents: Cassandra's research notes show discrepancies between Norma's original recipe and the one Morgan claims as 'family heritage.' Your instincts tell you this recipe theft is connected to the murder.
envelopes.instructions: Share evidence about recipe discrepancies. Focus on Morgan's false heritage claims.

envelopes.title: Envelope 3: Forensic Evidence
envelopes.contents: Lab report confirms it: the poisoned pie slice matches Morgan's recipe exactly—same unique spice blend that Norma created. The murder weapon came from the stolen recipe itself.
envelopes.instructions: Present forensic evidence. This is the scientific proof linking Morgan to the crime.

envelopes.title: Envelope 4: Case Solved
envelopes.contents: All evidence points to Morgan Blackwood: stolen recipe, false heritage, investor money at stake, Cassandra's proof threatening to expose it all. The poisoned pie was Morgan's desperate solution. Justice must be served.
envelopes.instructions: Present your complete case. Prepare for cupcake reveal that will publicly expose Morgan's guilt.

intro_profile.name: Shelly Johnson
intro_profile.tagline: The person who pours coffee hears all the secrets
intro_profile.overview: You are Shelly Johnson, a waitress at the Double R Diner. You know everything that happens in Twin Peaks because everyone talks at the diner. You're sweet and kind-hearted, but you're carrying heavy knowledge about recipe theft and threatening voicemails.
intro_profile.personality_notes: Warm, observant, protective. You care about people but sometimes know too much for your own good.
intro_profile.secret_preview: You overheard things at the diner that now make terrible sense...

envelopes.title: Envelope 1: The Early Morning Order
envelopes.contents: This morning Morgan came in at 6:30 AM and bought a whole cherry pie—very unusual. You kept the receipt without knowing why. Now Cassandra is dead and you're wondering if that pie was involved.
envelopes.instructions: Share the receipt evidence. Ask others about Morgan's behavior and recipe origins.

envelopes.title: Envelope 2: Norma's Missing Recipe
envelopes.contents: Norma confided in you last month that her secret cherry pie recipe went missing from her kitchen. She suspected theft but had no proof. Now Morgan is claiming a nearly identical recipe as her 'family heritage.'
envelopes.instructions: Reveal Norma's stolen recipe. Connect this theft to Morgan's business and Cassandra's investigation.

envelopes.title: Envelope 3: The Threatening Call
envelopes.contents: You found a saved voicemail on the diner phone meant for Cassandra: 'Drop the story or you'll regret it.' The voice sounds like Morgan trying to disguise it. This is serious.
envelopes.instructions: Share the threatening voicemail evidence. This shows Morgan's desperation and willingness to threaten.

envelopes.title: Envelope 4: Witness to Truth
envelopes.contents: Everything you heard at the diner comes together: the early morning pie order, Norma's theft report, the threatening call, Morgan's lies to investors. Cassandra died because she found the truth. You must speak up.
envelopes.instructions: Tell everyone what you witnessed. Your testimony confirms Morgan's guilt. Prepare for cupcake reveal.

intro_profile.name: The Log Lady
intro_profile.tagline: The log sees what others cannot
intro_profile.overview: You are the Log Lady, a mystic who carries a log that communicates truths others cannot perceive. While people think you're eccentric, your log has never been wrong. Tonight, it warns of stolen recipes, false heritage, and deadly consequences.
intro_profile.personality_notes: Mysterious, prophetic, utterly earnest. You believe the log speaks truth, and in its own way, it does.
intro_profile.secret_preview: Your log predicted tragedy around false claims and stolen treasures...
intro_profile.special_powers: SANCTIFY TRADE: Once per phase, you may declare a clue trade 'sanctified'—both parties must honor it truthfully. AMPLIFY: Once per phase, announce a critical clue dramatically to the whole group.

envelopes.title: Envelope 1: The Log's First Warning
envelopes.contents: The log grows heavy with dark visions: stolen recipes, false heritage claims, someone taking credit for another's work. It whispers 'Morgan' but you don't yet know why. Trust the log—it sees truth.
envelopes.instructions: Speak cryptically about theft and false claims. Use SANCTIFY TRADE or AMPLIFY power. Share your motive clue about stolen recipes.

envelopes.title: Envelope 2: Photographs in the Dark
envelopes.contents: The log shows you visions: secret photographs of recipe cards, taken without permission. Evidence of theft captured on camera. The log knows Cassandra found these photos. The log knows Morgan fears them.
envelopes.instructions: Reveal the secret photos clue dramatically. Use AMPLIFY to announce this to everyone. Use SANCTIFY TRADE once this phase.

envelopes.title: Envelope 3: The Log's Growing Urgency
envelopes.contents: The log trembles with revelation: the recipe thief became a murderer to protect her lies and investor money. Morgan Blackwood's ambition led to poison, silence, and death. The log sees all.
envelopes.instructions: Your warnings intensify. Point clearly toward Morgan. The log's prophecy is nearly complete.

envelopes.title: Envelope 4: The Log's Final Truth
envelopes.contents: The log speaks its final prophecy for all to hear: 'Morgan Blackwood stole Norma's recipe, lied to investors, and poisoned Cassandra to silence the truth. The cupcakes will reveal what the log already knows—Morgan is guilty.'
envelopes.instructions: Deliver the log's complete prophecy dramatically. Use AMPLIFY to announce this truth. Prepare for cupcake reveal ceremony.

intro_profile.name: Morgan Blackwood
intro_profile.tagline: Ambition and elegance at any cost
intro_profile.overview: You are Morgan Blackwood, owner of a new artisan pie business. You've told everyone your grandmother's 'heritage recipe' will make you rich. But the truth is darker—you stole Norma's secret recipe and passed it off as your own to secure investor funding. When Cassandra discovered your lie, you silenced her.
intro_profile.personality_notes: Elegant, ambitious, desperate. You've convinced yourself the theft was justified—you needed this success.
intro_profile.secret_preview: You stole the recipe, lied to investors, and poisoned Cassandra to protect your secret...

envelopes.title: Envelope 1: Maintaining the Facade
envelopes.contents: You must appear concerned about Cassandra's absence while hiding your relief. No one can know you stole Norma's recipe and claimed it as family heritage. The investors are here—everything depends on this lie holding.
envelopes.instructions: Act worried about Cassandra. Deflect questions about recipe origins. Use red herring clue about the socialite if needed.

envelopes.title: Envelope 2: Cracks Appearing
envelopes.contents: People are asking about your 'family recipe.' The waitress knows Norma reported a theft. The Log Lady speaks of stolen treasures. You need to divert attention—perhaps that old socialite rumor could help?
envelopes.instructions: Spread the red herring about the socialite. Keep attention away from yourself and the recipe theft.

envelopes.title: Envelope 3: The Walls Close In
envelopes.contents: The detective has forensic evidence. The Log Lady's prophecies point at you. They found Cassandra's phone showing you met her that morning. The photo evidence of recipe theft exists. Your desperation grows.
envelopes.instructions: Try one more red herring about the waitress. Deny everything. But you feel control slipping away.

envelopes.title: Envelope 4: Truth Revealed
envelopes.contents: It's over. They know you stole Norma's recipe, lied to investors for $50K, and poisoned Cassandra when she threatened to expose you. The cupcake reveal will spell out your guilt for everyone. You can confess or deny—either way, the truth comes out.
envelopes.instructions: Face the evidence. The cupcake reveal ceremony will publicly expose 'MORGAN BLACKWOOD IS GUILTY.' Decide how you'll respond.

intro_profile.name: Andy Brennan
intro_profile.overview: You are Andy Brennan, a deputy sheriff with a heart of gold. You're here to help keep everyone safe and support the investigation. You have witness statements and evidence about Morgan's suspicious activities that may prove crucial.
intro_profile.personality_notes: Kind-hearted, helpful, earnest. You try your best to support justice and help solve this mystery.
intro_profile.secret_preview: You've been collecting evidence about Morgan's activities...

envelopes.title: Envelope 1: Initial Evidence
envelopes.contents: You arrive ready to help. The detective has already cleared you—you were at the station all morning with security footage to prove it. Now you can focus on helping investigate. You have a witness statement about Morgan arguing with Cassandra.
envelopes.instructions: You're cleared as a suspect. Share your witness statement about Morgan and Cassandra arguing with papers visible.

envelopes.title: Envelope 2: Following the Trail
envelopes.contents: Your witness report is important: someone saw Morgan and Cassandra arguing outside the pie shop two days ago. Cassandra was waving papers—likely the photo evidence of recipe theft. This puts Morgan at the scene with motive.
envelopes.instructions: Share timeline evidence. Connect the argument to Cassandra's investigation and Morgan's fear of exposure.

envelopes.title: Envelope 3: Critical Discovery
envelopes.contents: You found Cassandra's phone in evidence. Her last text says: 'Meeting Morgan at shop to discuss the photos. She says she can explain.' This places them together right before Cassandra died.
envelopes.instructions: Share the phone evidence. This is critical timeline proof that Morgan was the last person to see Cassandra alive.

envelopes.title: Envelope 4: Justice Served
envelopes.contents: Your evidence helped crack the case: the witness statement, the phone text, the timeline. Morgan's guilt is clear. You've helped bring justice for Cassandra and truth for Norma's stolen recipe.
envelopes.instructions: Present your evidence proudly. You played a key role in solving this case. Prepare for cupcake reveal.
